titleStmt.title: Anthony Mills and Ambrose Cope to John Ware
CWG10042

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Knox County Ky January the 19 1861
Mr John Ware

Sir we want you to do one favor for we we want you to get the govner to permit A fine was Rendered Agants us at last sept term in 1860 in favor of the commonwealth in A case of gaming for the some of $20 Each an if yo will done this favor for to us we will satisfyed by you Just what ever you say an if you think we had better hav A pertishions want you to writ to me as quick as you you can me if you can git the fine permitted i want you to send it as quik as you can i can in form you that you peapul ar all well as far as i now At this time some more at present but Remains yors &c

Knox Cir Ct.
$211. }
A Mills &
A Cope
Respd 12. Mos
Issd Feby 15th
1861
